column4: I think the color stuff mught be dependent on some package as well...
but it works for the admin account just none of the new accounts
and the .bashrc is available to those users, and readable?
if you do "source ~/.bashrc with the user?
but if you login with the user I think it's done automatically...
worth a try though, you might even get an error to hunt...
bash cant find source on those users logged in
so those users are not allowed to use source?
I dont know bash just cant seem to find it
hmm, source is a natvie bash command... I'm just as confused here... you could ask in #ubuntu-server
figured it out, my users were in /etc/passwd all those users are set to use sh not bash, quick edit and it works
